original: ta zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid las ma g-yos pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //🔽ya zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ta zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid las ma g-yos pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o // ya zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “The syllable ta is the gateway to all phenomena because it does not waver from suchness.🔽“The syllable ya is the gateway to all phenomena because it is not observed in reality.

original: sta zhes bya ba ni khengs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //🔽ka zhes bya ba ni byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sta zhes bya ba ni khengs pa dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o // ka zhes bya ba ni byed pa po mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: “The syllable sta is the gateway to all phenomena because it is not observed to be inflated.

original: chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //🔽sa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sgo'o // sa zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa nyid mi dmigs pas /
translated: “The syllable ka is the gateway to all phenomena because it is not observed to be an agent.

original: mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid las mi 'da' ba'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “The syllable sa is the gateway to all phenomena because it is not observed to be equality, and because it does not transcend equality.🔽“The syllable ma is the gateway to all phenomena because it is not observed to be one’s own action.

original: ma zhes bya ba ni bdag gi bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o; ;ga zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ma zhes bya ba ni bdag gi bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o; ;ga zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “The syllable ga is the gateway to all phenomena because it is not observed to be a destination.

original: tha zhes bya ba ni gnas mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: tha zhes bya ba ni gnas mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “The syllable tha is the gateway to all phenomena because it is not observed to be a place.

original: dz'a zhes bya ba ni skye ba mi dmigs @345b pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: dz'a zhes bya ba ni skye ba mi dmigs @345b pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable ja is the gateway to all phenomena because birth is not observed.

original: shva zhes bya ba ni dbugs dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: shva zhes bya ba ni dbugs dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable śva is the gateway to all phenomena because inhalation is not observed.

original: dha zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: dha zhes bya ba ni chos kyi dbyings dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable dha is the gateway to all phenomena because the realm of phenomena is not observed.

original: sha zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //🔽kha zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pas dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: sha zhes bya ba ni zhi gnas dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o // kha zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang mnyam pas dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable śa is the gateway to all phenomena because śamatha is not observed.🔽The syllable kha is the gateway to all phenomena because space is not observed.

original: ksha zhes bya ba ni zad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ksha zhes bya ba ni zad pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable kṣa is the gateway to all phenomena because exhaustion is not observed.

original: sta zhes bya ba ni bstod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: sta zhes bya ba ni bstod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable sta is the gateway to all phenomena because praise is not observed.

original: dz'a zhes bya ba ni ye shes mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: dz'a zhes bya ba ni ye shes mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable ja is the gateway to all phenomena because wisdom is not observed.

original: rta zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: rta zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable ta is the gateway to all phenomena because afflictions are non-apprehensible.

original: ha zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ha zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable ha is the gateway to all phenomena because causes are non-apprehensible.

original: bha zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: bha zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable bha is the gateway to all phenomena because of the absence of fear.

original: tsha zhes bya ba ni mdog mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: tsha zhes bya ba ni mdog mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable tsa is the gateway to all phenomena because of the absence of color.

original: sma zhes bya ba ni dran pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //🔽hva zhes bya ba ni bong ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //🔽t+sra zhes bya ba ni mos pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: sma zhes bya ba ni dran pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o // hva zhes bya ba ni bong ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o // t+sra zhes bya ba ni mos pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable sma is the gateway to all phenomena because of the absence of recollection.🔽The syllable hwa is the gateway to all phenomena because of the absence of a lump.🔽The syllable tsra is the gateway to all phenomena because of the absence of interest.

original: gha zhes bya ba ni stug po mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: gha zhes bya ba ni stug po mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable gha is the gateway to all phenomena because of the absence of density.

original: tha zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: tha zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The syllable tha is the gateway to all phenomena because of the absence of accomplishment.

original: na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pas gang yang 'gro ba med cing 'ong ba med @346a *//
analyzed: na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa med pas gang yang 'gro ba med cing 'ong ba med @346a *//
translated: Na means that since there is no affliction, there is neither coming nor going.🔽🔽

original: de; gnas pa med cing 'dug pa med la /🔽nyal bar 'gyur ba med pas /🔽rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: de; gnas pa med cing 'dug pa med la / nyal bar 'gyur ba med pas / rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “Na” is the gateway to all phenomena because it is non-conceptual, since there is no coming or going, no abiding or remaining, and no lying down.

original: pha zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: pha zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “ Pha” is the gateway to all phenomena because the result is unobservable.

original: ska zhes bya ba ni phung po dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ska zhes bya ba ni phung po dmigs su med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “ Ska” is the gateway to all phenomena because the aggregates are unobservable.

original: ya zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: ya zhes bya ba ni mi bde ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “ Ya” is the gateway to all phenomena because discomfort is unobservable.

original: tsa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //🔽ta zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mi dmigs pa dang / mthar thug par gnas par 'chi 'pho med cing /
analyzed: tsa zhes bya ba ni spyod pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o // ta zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mi dmigs pa dang / mthar thug par gnas par 'chi 'pho med cing /
translated: “ Ca” is the gateway to all phenomena because conduct is unobservable.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir chos thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: “ Ta” is the gateway to all phenomena because suffering is unobservable, and because there is no death and no rebirth, since one abides in the ultimate.🔽“

original: dha zhes bya ba ni g-yog pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dha zhes bya ba ni g-yog pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: The syllable “dha” means that the retinue is not observed.🔽

original: chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi sgo ste /
translated: “The syllable dha is the gateway to all phenomena, because it is the non-apprehension of a carrier.

original: de yan chad ni yi ge tha snyad med do //
analyzed: de yan chad ni yi ge tha snyad med do //
translated: “Beyond that, there are no syllables or conventions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de ni 'di ltar gang la yang gang gis tha snyad du bya ba dang / gang gis brjod pa dang / gang gis bstan pa dang / gang bri ba dang / gang snang ba dang / gang bklag par bya ba de lta bu'i ming gang yang med do //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na; de ni 'di ltar gang la yang gang gis tha snyad du bya ba dang / gang gis brjod pa dang / gang gis bstan pa dang / gang bri ba dang / gang snang ba dang / gang bklag par bya ba de lta bu'i ming gang yang med do //
translated: Why is that? Because there are no names at all for anything that is conventionally designated, expressed, taught, written, seen, or read.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: all phenomena

original: dper na / nam mkha' bzhin du khongs su chud par bya ste /
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' bzhin du khongs su chud par bya ste /
translated: are to be included in space.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ni gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa; aa la sogs pa'i yi ge bstan pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni gzungs kyi sgo la 'jug pa; aa la sogs pa'i yi ge bstan pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, this is the entrance into the dhāraṇī gateway, the entrance into the teaching of the syllables such as a.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis /
translated: Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings

original: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la mkhas par bya ba 'di yongs @346b su shes na /
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la mkhas par bya ba 'di yongs @346b su shes na /
translated: know this skill in the syllables such as a,

original: de ni sgra gang la'ang chags par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de ni sgra gang la'ang chags par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: They will not be attached to any sound.

original: thams cad chos nyid kyis yang dag par bsgrub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad chos nyid kyis yang dag par bsgrub par 'gyur te /
translated: Everything will be accomplished by the nature of reality.

original: sgra shes par bya ba la mkhas pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra shes par bya ba la mkhas pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will attain expertise in understanding sounds.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' gang gis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' gang gis /
translated: Subhūti, if any bodhisattvas

original: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya 'di dang / aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya'i tshig 'di dag thos te /
analyzed: aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya 'di dang / aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la 'jug pa'i phyag rgya'i tshig 'di dag thos te /
translated: hear this seal of engagement with the letters beginning with A, and these words that are the seal of engagement with the letters beginning with A,

original: thos nas kyang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed cing /
analyzed: thos nas kyang 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / klog pa dang / kun chub par byed cing /
translated: and having heard them, retain them, hold them, read them, master them,

original: gzhan la'ang tshul dang ldan pa'i blos ston na /
analyzed: gzhan la'ang tshul dang ldan pa'i blos ston na /
translated: and teach them to others with a proper mind,

original: de la legs pa nyi shu yod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de la legs pa nyi shu yod par shes par bya'o //
translated: they should know that there are twenty benefits.

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dran pa dang ldan /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dran pa dang ldan /
translated: They are as follows:🔽They will be mindful.

original: blo gros dang ldan /🔽rtogs pa dang ldan /
analyzed: blo gros dang ldan / rtogs pa dang ldan /
translated: They will be intelligent.🔽They will be understanding.

original: blo dang ldan /
analyzed: blo dang ldan /
translated: They will be wise.

original: dga' ba dang ldan /
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan /
translated: They will be joyful.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan /
translated: They will be conscientious.

original: spobs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / gzungs kyi sgo 'di'ang nyon mongs pa med par 'thob cing /
analyzed: spobs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / gzungs kyi sgo 'di'ang nyon mongs pa med par 'thob cing /
translated: They will be endowed with eloquence and attain this dhāraṇī door without affliction.

original: the tshom med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: the tshom med par 'gyur la /
translated: They will be free from doubt.

original: gzhan las sgra'i ngag snyan pa thos kyang chags par 'gyur ba med cing /
analyzed: gzhan las sgra'i ngag snyan pa thos kyang chags par 'gyur ba med cing /
translated: Even if they hear pleasant sounds from others, they will not become attached.

original: zhe gcod pa'i tshig thos kyang khong khro bar mi 'gyur bas; mtho ba med cing dma' ba med de /
analyzed: zhe gcod pa'i tshig thos kyang khong khro bar mi 'gyur bas; mtho ba med cing dma' ba med de /
translated: Even if they hear unpleasant words, they will not become angry. They will be free from pride and free from low self-esteem.

original: tshul bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / sgra la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / phung po la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / khams la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / skye mched la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / bden pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: tshul bzhin du gnas par 'gyur ba dang / sgra la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / phung po la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / khams la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / skye mched la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / bden pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will be skilled in sound, skilled in the aggregates, skilled in the elements, skilled in the sense sources, skilled in the truths,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa ste /
translated: and skilled in dependent origination.

original: rgyu la mkhas shing rkyen la mkhas @347a *//
analyzed: rgyu la mkhas shing rkyen la mkhas @347a *//
translated: They will be skilled in causes and skilled in conditions.

original: par 'gyur ba dang / chos nyid la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / dbang po rab dang tha ma shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /🔽lha'i rna ba'i shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: par 'gyur ba dang / chos nyid la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / dbang po rab dang tha ma shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / lha'i rna ba'i shes pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam pa shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: They will become skilled in the knowledge of the past and future, the knowledge of the present, the knowledge of the nature of phenomena, the knowledge of the higher and lower faculties of beings, the knowledge of death and rebirth,🔽the knowledge of the divine ear, the knowledge of the minds of others, the knowledge of the recollection of past lives, the knowledge of the performance of miracles,

original: zag pa zad pa shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa bstan pa shes par bya ba mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba la mkhas shing ldog pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / spyod lam la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa shes par bya ba la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa bstan pa shes par bya ba mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / 'gro ba la mkhas shing ldog pa la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang / spyod lam la mkhas par 'gyur ba dang /

original: khrel yod pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa la mkhas pa'ang 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: khrel yod pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa la mkhas pa'ang 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: they will also attain skill in shame and embarrassment.

original: rab 'byor / gzungs kyi sgo aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la 'jug pa 'di'ang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzungs kyi sgo aa la sogs pa'i yi ge la 'jug pa 'di'ang de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po'o //
translated: Subhūti, this dhāraṇī gateway of the letters such as A is also the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings, because it is not apprehended.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las le'u dgu pa'o;; ;;rab 'byor /🔽gang yang khyod 'di skad du ji ltar na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa las le'u dgu pa'o;; ;;rab 'byor / gang yang khyod 'di skad du ji ltar na /
translated: This was the ninth chapter, “Dhāraṇī,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhes zer ba ni /🔽@347b rab 'byor /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin zhes zer ba ni / @347b rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, you have asked, “How do bodhisattva great beings set out in the Great Vehicle?”

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections

original: sa nas sar 'phar te /
analyzed: sa nas sar 'phar te /
translated: pass on from ground to ground.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyod cing /
translated: Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings practicing the six perfections

original: sa nas sar 'phar ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: sa nas sar 'phar ba yin zhe na /
translated: If you ask what is the bodhisattvas’ and great spiritual heroes’ purification of the levels,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is as follows:

original: chos thams cad 'pho ba med pas /
analyzed: chos thams cad 'pho ba med pas /
translated: Since all phenomena are without transference,

original: chos gang yang 'ong ba med cing /🔽'gro ba med de /
analyzed: chos gang yang 'ong ba med cing / 'gro ba med de /
translated: no phenomenon comes or goes,

original: 'pho ba 'am nye bar 'pho ba med do //🔽'on kyang chos thams cad kyi sa gang yin pa de la rlom sems su byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'pho ba 'am nye bar 'pho ba med do // 'on kyang chos thams cad kyi sa gang yin pa de la rlom sems su byed pa'am /
translated: and there is no transference or near transference.

original: sems pa med par sa yongs su sbyong ba'ang mi byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: sems pa med par sa yongs su sbyong ba'ang mi byed pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is not that they do not purify the levels without conceiving of or thinking about the level of any phenomenon,

original: sa de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: sa de'ang yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: and yet they do not see that level.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa yongs su sbyong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa yongs su sbyong ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattvas’ and great spiritual heroes’ purification of the levels?

original: rab 'byor / sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa yongs su sbyang ba bcu po 'di dag bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sa dang po la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa yongs su sbyang ba bcu po 'di dag bya ste /
translated: Su­bhūti, the bodhisattvas, the great spiritual heroes, who are established in the first level should purify ten levels.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: If you ask what are the ten,

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir; phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyang zhing /🔽sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir; phan pa'i dngos po yongs su sbyang zhing / sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: They should purify the beneficial by not observing signs.🔽They should purify the sameness of mind toward all beings by not observing beings.

original: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba dang / sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba dang / sbyin pa dang / gtong ba dang / len pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: They should purify giving by not observing giving, recipients, or those who give.

original: gtong pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / des rlom sems su mi bya ba'i phyir /🔽dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs @348a *//
analyzed: gtong pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / des rlom sems su mi bya ba'i phyir / dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs @348a *//
translated: They should purify reliance on spiritual friends by not conceiving of them.🔽They should purify the search for the Dharma by not observing any Dharma.🔽They should purify the repeated arising by not observing a home.

original: pa'i phyir / chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / khyim mi dmigs pa'i phyir yang dang yang 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po'i mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pa'i phyir / chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / khyim mi dmigs pa'i phyir yang dang yang 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po'i mtshan ma mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: They should purify the major and minor marks by not observing the signs of the major and minor marks.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / chos kyi rnam pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba dang / chos kyi rnam pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: purifying devotion to the Buddha’s body,

original: chos rnam par dbye ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / chos kyi yang dag pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnam par dbye ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / chos kyi yang dag pa nyid mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: purifying the discernment of phenomena by not objectifying the aspects of phenomena,🔽purifying the elimination of pride and arrogance by not objectifying the reality of phenomena,

original: nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / tshig mi dmigs pa'i phyir bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba dang / tshig mi dmigs pa'i phyir bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba ste /
translated: purifying the words of truth by not objectifying words.

original: rab 'byor / yongs su sbyang ba bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / yongs su sbyang ba bcu po de dag ni /
translated: Subhūti, these ten are the purifications

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pas bya ba dag go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pas bya ba dag go /
translated: that the bodhisattva great beings abiding on the first ground should practice.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas /🔽chos brgyad po 'di dag yang dang yang yid la bya zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas / chos brgyad po 'di dag yang dang yang yid la bya zhing /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings abiding on the second ground🔽should repeatedly keep in mind and practice

original: de dag la nan tan du bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la nan tan du bya'o //
translated: these eight dharmas.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba dang / bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa dang / rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa dang / byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba dang / bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa dang / rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba dang /
translated: They are to be completely pure in terms of discipline, to be grateful and appreciative, to abide in the power of patience, to experience great joy and delight, to never abandon any sentient being,

original: snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur zhing dad pas gus par bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson zhing tshol ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba dang / bla ma la bsnyen bkur zhing dad pas gus par bya ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson zhing tshol ba ste /
translated: to actualize great compassion, to respect and have faith in the gurus, and to strive and seek the perfections.🔽Subhūti, these eight dharmas are those

original: rab 'byor / chos brgyad po de dag ni byang @348b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos brgyad po de dag ni byang @348b chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pas /
translated: that the bodhisattva great beings abiding on the second ground

original: yang dang yang yid la bya zhing de dag la nan tan du bya ba dag go /
analyzed: yang dang yang yid la bya zhing de dag la nan tan du bya ba dag go /
translated: should repeatedly keep in mind and practice.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gsum pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gsum pa la gnas pas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings abiding on the third ground

original: chos lnga la gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: chos lnga la gnas par bya ste /
translated: should abide in five dharmas.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mang du thos pas mi ngoms shing /
analyzed: mang du thos pas mi ngoms shing /
translated: not being satisfied with much learning,

original: de la'ang yi ge la mngon par ma zhen pa dang / zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'byed cing /
analyzed: de la'ang yi ge la mngon par ma zhen pa dang / zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'byed cing /
translated: and not being attached to the letters, and discerning the gift of the Dharma without material possessions,🔽and not becoming conceited because of that, and producing and dedicating the roots of virtue to the purification of a buddhafield,

original: des kyang rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo'ang des rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba dang / dpag tu med pa'i 'khor bas yongs su skyo ba med cing /
analyzed: des kyang rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo'ang des rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba dang / dpag tu med pa'i 'khor bas yongs su skyo ba med cing /
translated: and not becoming conceited because of that, and not being discouraged by the infinite saṃsāra,

original: des kyang rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba dang / ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa la gnas kyang /
analyzed: des kyang rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba dang / ngo tsha shes shing khrel yod pa la gnas kyang /
translated: and not becoming conceited because of that, and abiding in a sense of shame and a sense of integrity,

original: des rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba ste /🔽rab 'byor / chos lnga po de dag ni /
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi 'gyur ba ste / rab 'byor / chos lnga po de dag ni /
translated: and not becoming conceited because of that.🔽Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gsum pa la gnas pas gnas par bya ba dag go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gsum pa la gnas pas gnas par bya ba dag go /
translated: these five dharmas are those by which the bodhisattva great beings standing on the third ground should stand.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bzhi pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bzhi pa la gnas pas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings standing on the fourth ground

original: chos bcu po 'di dag yongs su blangs shing gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: chos bcu po 'di dag yongs su blangs shing gnas par bya ste /
translated: “They should take up and maintain these ten dharmas.

original: de dag yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag yongs su gtang bar mi bya'o //
translated: They should not give them up.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dgon pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi sdom pa mi gtong ba dang / bslab pa yongs su mi @349a *//
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dgon pa la gnas pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyi sdom pa mi gtong ba dang / bslab pa yongs su mi @349a *//
translated: They are as follows:

original: gtong ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan la smad pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / rdzas thams cad yongs su btang ba dang / sems zhum pa med pa dang / dngos po thams cad la bltos pa med pa ste /🔽rab 'byor / chos bcu po de dag ni /
analyzed: gtong ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan la smad pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dang / rdzas thams cad yongs su btang ba dang / sems zhum pa med pa dang / dngos po thams cad la bltos pa med pa ste / rab 'byor / chos bcu po de dag ni /
translated: dwelling in the wilderness, having few desires, being content, not giving up the ascetic practices, not giving up the trainings, disparaging the pleasures of the senses, giving rise to the thought of attaining nirvāṇa, giving away all possessions, not being disheartened, and not being concerned with any possessions.🔽Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bzhi pa la gnas pas yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bzhi pa la gnas pas yongs su gtang bar mi bya zhing /
translated: these ten dharmas are not to be given up by bodhisattva great beings dwelling on the fourth ground.

original: yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya ba dag go /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs te gnas par bya ba dag go /
translated: They should take them up and maintain them.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa lnga pa la gnas pas; chos drug po 'di dag yongs su spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa lnga pa la gnas pas; chos drug po 'di dag yongs su spang bar bya ste /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings in the fifth bhūmi should give up six dharmas.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: 'di ltar khyim pa dang bsten pa yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / dge slong ma dang bsten pa dang / rigs la ser sna byed pa dang / 'du 'dzi'i gnas dang / gnod sems dang / bdag bstod cing gzhan smod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyim pa dang bsten pa yongs su spang bar bya ba dang / dge slong ma dang bsten pa dang / rigs la ser sna byed pa dang / 'du 'dzi'i gnas dang / gnod sems dang / bdag bstod cing gzhan smod pa ste /
translated: They are: giving up associating with householders, giving up associating with bhikṣus, being miserly with families, being in a place of distraction, malice, and praising oneself and disparaging others.

original: chos drug po de dag ni yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos drug po de dag ni yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: Those six dharmas should be given up.

original: yang chos brgyad yongs su spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang chos brgyad yongs su spang bar bya ste /
translated: “Moreover, they should give up eight dharmas.

original: 'di ltar mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: They are: giving up the ten unwholesome actions,

original: lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / khengs pa dang / phyin ci log rnams dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug nyam rangs su gzhug pa yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i nga rgyal dang / khengs pa dang / phyin ci log rnams dang / the tshom dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug nyam rangs su gzhug pa yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: giving up excessive pride, arrogance, the distortions, doubt, desire, anger, and allowing delusion to run rampant.

original: chos brgyad po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa lnga pa la gnas pas @349b yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos brgyad po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa lnga pa la gnas pas @349b yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: These eight dharmas should be completely abandoned by the bodhisattva great beings on the fifth ground.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings on the sixth ground

original: chos drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: chos drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: should complete six dharmas.

original: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug go /
translated: They are the six perfections.

original: gzhan yang chos drug yongs su spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang chos drug yongs su spang bar bya ste /
translated: Furthermore, they should completely abandon six dharmas.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: nyan thos kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: They should completely abandon the śrāvaka mind.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: They should completely abandon the pratyekabuddha mind.

original: sred pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: They should completely abandon the mind of craving.

original: slong mo pa mthong na zhum pa med par bya ste /
analyzed: slong mo pa mthong na zhum pa med par bya ste /
translated: When they see a beggar, they should not be discouraged.

original: zhum pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhum pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: They should completely abandon a discouraged mind.

original: dngos po thams cad yongs su btang bas yid mi bde bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yongs su btang bas yid mi bde bar mi bya ste /
translated: They should not be unhappy about giving away all things.

original: yid mi bde ba yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: They should completely abandon unhappiness.

original: slong mo pa mthong na slong mo pas 'khrug par mi bya ste /
analyzed: slong mo pa mthong na slong mo pas 'khrug par mi bya ste /
translated: When they see beggars, they should not be disturbed,

original: 'khrug pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i sems yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: and they should completely abandon any disturbed thoughts.

original: rab 'byor / chos drug po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos drug po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa drug pa la gnas pas yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, these six dharmas should be abandoned by bodhisattva great beings on the sixth ground.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings on the seventh ground

original: chos nyi shu mi bya ste; nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyi shu mi bya ste; nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: should not engage in twenty dharmas. What are the twenty?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not grasp at a self,

original: sems can du 'dzin pa dang / srog tu 'dzin pa dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa dang / chad par 'dzin pa dang / rtag par 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / rgyur lta ba dang / ming dang gzugs la mngon par chags pa dang /
analyzed: sems can du 'dzin pa dang / srog tu 'dzin pa dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa dang / chad par 'dzin pa dang / rtag par 'dzin pa dang / mtshan ma'i 'du shes dang / rgyur lta ba dang / ming dang gzugs la mngon par chags pa dang /
translated: grasp at a sentient being, grasp at a life-force, grasp at a person, grasp at annihilation, grasp at permanence, the perception of marks, the view of causality, or attachment to name and form.

original: phung po la mngon par chags pa dang / khams la mngon par chags pa dang / skye mched la @350a *//
analyzed: phung po la mngon par chags pa dang / khams la mngon par chags pa dang / skye mched la @350a *//
translated: attachment to the aggregates, attachment to the elements, attachment to the sense spheres,

original: mngon par chags pa dang / khams gsum la mngon par chags pa dang / khams gsum la mngon par zhen pa dang / khams gsum la brten pa dang / khams gsum la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang /
analyzed: mngon par chags pa dang / khams gsum la mngon par chags pa dang / khams gsum la mngon par zhen pa dang / khams gsum la brten pa dang / khams gsum la gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang /
translated: attachment to the three realms, clinging to the three realms, reliance on the three realms, dwelling in the three realms, attachment to the view of relying on the Buddha,

original: chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / dge 'dun la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / chos rnams stong ngo zhes zhum par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: chos la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / dge 'dun la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / tshul khrims la brten pa'i lta ba la mngon par chags pa dang / chos rnams stong ngo zhes zhum par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: attachment to the view of relying on the Dharma, attachment to the view of relying on the Saṅgha, attachment to the view of relying on morality, and being disheartened by the emptiness of phenomena,

original: stong pa nyid dang 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang 'gal ba ste /
translated: and contradicting emptiness.

original: rab 'byor / chos nyi shu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos nyi shu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas mi bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, these twenty dharmas should not be done by bodhisattva mahāsattvas dwelling on the seventh bhūmi.

original: des chos nyi shu po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: des chos nyi shu po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: “They should perfect these twenty qualities.

original: nyi shu gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyi shu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty?

original: 'di lta ste; stong pa nyid rdzogs par bya ba dang / mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba dang / smon pa med pa shes par bya ba dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad la snying rje zhing snying brtse ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste; stong pa nyid rdzogs par bya ba dang / mtshan ma med pa mngon du bya ba dang / smon pa med pa shes par bya ba dang / 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa dang / sems can thams cad la snying rje zhing snying brtse ba dang /
translated: They are the perfection of emptiness, the manifestation of the absence of marks, the knowledge of the absence of wishes, the complete purity of the three spheres, compassion and love for all sentient beings,

original: sems can de dag la brnyas par mi bya ba dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du lta ba yang dag pa'i tshul rab tu rtogs shing /
analyzed: sems can de dag la brnyas par mi bya ba dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du lta ba yang dag pa'i tshul rab tu rtogs shing /
translated: not looking down on those sentient beings, the correct realization of the view that all phenomena are the same,

original: des rlom sems su mi bya ba dang / mi skye ba la bzod pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos thams cad tshul gcig tu bstan pa dang / rtog pa yang dag par bsal ba dang / lta ba rnam par bzlog pa dang /
analyzed: des rlom sems su mi bya ba dang / mi skye ba la bzod pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos thams cad tshul gcig tu bstan pa dang / rtog pa yang dag par bsal ba dang / lta ba rnam par bzlog pa dang /
translated: and not being conceited about that, patience with nonarising, the knowledge of nonarising, teaching all phenomena as having a single mode, the removal of concepts, the reversal of views,

original: nyon mongs @350b pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sa dang / dul ba'i sems dang / zhi ba'i sems dang / thogs pa med pa dang / byams pa'i skabs shes pa dang / gang du 'dod pa'i zhing du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs @350b pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi sa dang / dul ba'i sems dang / zhi ba'i sems dang / thogs pa med pa dang / byams pa'i skabs shes pa dang / gang du 'dod pa'i zhing du 'gro ba ste /
translated: the elimination of afflictions, the stage of śamatha and vipaśyanā, a disciplined mind, a peaceful mind, unobstructedness, understanding the context of loving kindness, and going to any buddhafield one wishes.

original: rab 'byor / chos nyi shu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos nyi shu po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bdun pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, these twenty dharmas are to be completed by bodhisattva great beings on the seventh bhūmi.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings on the eighth bhūmi

original: chos bzhi po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di dag yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: should complete four dharmas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?🔽They are: understanding the minds of all sentient beings, playing with the superknowledges, seeing buddhafields,

original: 'di ltar / sems can thams cad kyi sems khong du chud par bya ba dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing lta zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar / sems can thams cad kyi sems khong du chud par bya ba dang / mngon par shes pas rnam par rtse ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing lta zhing /
translated: and

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji ltar mthong ba de dag yongs su bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas bsnyen bkur zhing; sangs rgyas kyi sku yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtag pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing ji ltar mthong ba de dag yongs su bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas bsnyen bkur zhing; sangs rgyas kyi sku yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtag pa ste /
translated: to accomplish the buddha-fields as they have been seen; to serve the buddhas; and to have a buddha-body that is permanent, just as it is.

original: rab 'byor / chos bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, these four dharmas are to be completed by bodhisattva great beings standing on the eighth level.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad po la gnas pas chos bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad po la gnas pas chos bzhi yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing on the eighth level complete four dharmas.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dbang po rab dang / tha ma shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la yang dang yang mnyam par bzhag pa dang / sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta ji ltar @351a *//
analyzed: dbang po rab dang / tha ma shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyang ba dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la yang dang yang mnyam par bzhag pa dang / sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ji lta ji ltar @351a *//
translated: knowing the superior and inferior faculties; purifying a buddhafield; repeatedly settling into the illusion-like meditative stabilization; and according to the wholesome roots of beings,

original: 'grub par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar lus yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'grub par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar lus yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: and in order to accomplish the body of a Buddha,

original: ched du bsam zhing srid pa nye bar len pa ste /
analyzed: ched du bsam zhing srid pa nye bar len pa ste /
translated: he deliberately takes up existence.

original: rab 'byor / chos bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos bzhi po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa brgyad pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'o //
translated: Subhūti, these four dharmas are to be fully completed by the bodhisattva great being on the eighth stage.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great being on the ninth stage

original: chos bcu gnyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: chos bcu gnyis yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: should complete twelve dharmas.

original: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twelve?

original: 'di ltar smon lam mtha' yas pa yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar smon lam mtha' yas pa yongs su bzung ste /
translated: They are: taking up infinite prayers,

original: ji lta ji ltar smon pa de lta de ltar phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i skad shes pa dang /
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar smon pa de lta de ltar phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i skad shes pa dang /
translated: and then, as prayed, accomplishing them; and knowing the languages of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas;

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i spobs pas nges par bstan pa shes pa dang / ma'i mngal du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyud phun sum tshogs pa dang / rus phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i spobs pas nges par bstan pa shes pa dang / ma'i mngal du 'gro ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / rigs phun sum tshogs pa dang / rgyud phun sum tshogs pa dang / rus phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of teaching through complete eloquence, the perfection of entering the mother’s womb, the perfection of family, the perfection of lineage, the perfection of clan, the perfection of retinue,

original: tshe phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: tshe phun sum tshogs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa dang / yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: the perfection of life, the perfection of renunciation, the perfection of adorning the Bodhi tree, and the perfection of completing all good qualities.

original: rab 'byor / chos bcu gnyis po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos bcu gnyis po de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dgu pa la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, these twelve dharmas are to be completed by the bodhisattva mahāsattva on the ninth bhūmi.

original: rab 'byor / @351b sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / @351b sa bcu pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva on the tenth bhūmi is said to be a tathāgata.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis /🔽bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis / bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: The Lord having said that,🔽the venerable Subhūti said to him,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyang ba gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa yongs su sbyang ba gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of superior intention and so on on the first level?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, with the thought of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po yongs su dag par sdug pa 'di ni /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mang po yongs su dag par sdug pa 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: have a lot of wholesome roots that are purified.🔽That is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of superior intention.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of the attitude of sameness toward all beings?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas /
translated: It is the generation of the mind of omniscience.

original: tshad med pa bzhi po byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms mngon par bsgrub pa 'di ni /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi po byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms mngon par bsgrub pa 'di ni /
translated: It is the accomplishment of the four immeasurables: love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pa nyid yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of the sameness of mind toward all sentient beings.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gtong pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gtong pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of giving?

original: sems can thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med par sbyin pa yongs su @352a *//🔽gtong ba ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med par sbyin pa yongs su @352a *// gtong ba ste /
translated: It is giving without conceptualizing all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i gtong ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of giving.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of attending on spiritual friends?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: gang de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang dag par bskul ba dang / gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog par byed pa de dag ni /
analyzed: gang de la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang dag par bskul ba dang / gzhog pa dang / rab tu gzhog par byed pa de dag ni /
translated: Those who exhort, establish, and settle them in the knowledge of all aspects

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen te /
translated: are the spiritual teachers of bodhisattva great beings.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag la bsten pa dang / rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag la bsten pa dang / rim gror bya ba dang / bkur stir bya ba dang / bsti stang du bya ba ste /
translated: They should attend on, serve, honor, and respect those spiritual teachers.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of attending on spiritual teachers.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of seeking the Dharma?

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas chos 'tshol zhing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pas chos 'tshol zhing /
translated: They seek the Dharma with a thought connected with the knowledge of all aspects,

original: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ba 'di ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar mi ltung ba 'di ni /
translated: without falling into the śrāvaka level or the pratyekabuddha level.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos btsal ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of seeking the Dharma.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dang yang 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dang yang 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of being born again and again?

original: tshe rabs thams cad du 'du 'dzi med par 'byung zhing /
analyzed: tshe rabs thams cad du 'du 'dzi med par 'byung zhing /
translated: It is being born in all lives without being distracted,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung yang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung yang /
translated: and being born in the teachings of the Tathāgata,

original: de la bar chad byed pa gang yang med pa 'di ni @352b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dang yang 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: de la bar chad byed pa gang yang med pa 'di ni @352b byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yang dang yang 'byung ba yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: and not having any obstacles. This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of being born again and again.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of devotion to the body of the Buddha?

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku mthong nas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku mthong nas /
translated: It is seeing the body of the Buddha,

original: nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par ma gyur gyi bar du /
analyzed: nam rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob par ma gyur gyi bar du /
translated: and not turning away from it until one has attained omniscience.

original: sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: and never being separated from the thought of the Buddha.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi sku la mos pa yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of devotion to the Buddha’s body.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par dbye ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par dbye ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of the discernment of phenomena?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du gyur pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du gyur pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe /
translated: When the bodhisattva-mahāsattva is in the presence of the Tathāgata, at the time of his parinirvāṇa,

original: sems can rnams la chos ston cing /
analyzed: sems can rnams la chos ston cing /
translated: he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings,

original: thog mar yang dge /🔽bar du yang dge /
analyzed: thog mar yang dge / bar du yang dge /
translated: which is virtuous in the beginning,🔽virtuous in the middle,

original: tha mar yang dge /🔽yi ge bzang po /
analyzed: tha mar yang dge / yi ge bzang po /
translated: and virtuous in the end.

original: don bzang po /
analyzed: don bzang po /
translated: It has good words and good meaning.

original: ma 'dres pa /🔽yongs su rdzogs pa /🔽yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa / yongs su rdzogs pa / yongs su dag pa /
translated: It is unadulterated,🔽complete,🔽pure,

original: yongs su byang ba /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba /
translated: and refined.

original: tshangs pa'i spyod pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i spyod pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is the practice of celibacy, which is as follows:

original: mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'di ltar 'das pa dang skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang / rmad du byung ba dang /
analyzed: mdo dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / 'di ltar 'das pa dang skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang / rmad du byung ba dang /
translated: They are the discourses, the melodies, the predictions, the verses, the aphorisms, the narratives, the explanations, the stories of past lives, the extensive teachings, the marvelous events,

original: rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa dag yang dag par ston pa ste /🔽'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par dbye ba yongs su sbyang @353a *//
analyzed: rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gtan la phab par bstan pa dag yang dag par ston pa ste / 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i chos rnam par dbye ba yongs su sbyang @353a *//
translated: the teachings on knowledge, and the instructions.🔽“What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of the analysis of phenomena?

original: ba'o; ;de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal dang / khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ba'o; ;de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal dang / khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of the removal of pride and arrogance?

original: nga rgyal dang khengs pa ji ltar bsal ba des; nam yang rigs dma' bar mi skye ba 'di ni /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang khengs pa ji ltar bsal ba des; nam yang rigs dma' bar mi skye ba 'di ni /
translated: It is the removal of pride and arrogance such that one is never born into a low caste.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba'o ////
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i nga rgyal dang khengs pa bsal ba yongs su sbyang ba'o ////
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ purification of the removal of pride and arrogance.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-five Thousand Lines

original: bam po bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: Eighteenth

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of truthful speech?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: ji skad du smras pa de ltar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa de ltar byed pa ste /
translated: acting in accordance with one’s words.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bden pa'i tshig yongs su sbyang ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s purification of truthful speech.

original: rab 'byor / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i yongs su sbyang ba bcu'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa dang po la gnas pa'i yongs su sbyang ba bcu'o //
translated: Subhūti, those are the ten purifications for the bodhisattva-mahāsattva on the first ground.

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa gang zhe na; 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa gnyis pa la gnas pa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa gang zhe na; 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, what is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s pure morality while on the second ground?

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yid la mi byed cing /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems yid la mi byed cing /
translated: It is this: not attending to the mindsets of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: de ma yin pa tshul khrims ngan par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi gegs su 'gyur ba'i chos gzhan dag kyang yid la mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: de ma yin pa tshul khrims ngan par byed pa dang / byang chub kyi gegs su 'gyur ba'i chos gzhan dag kyang yid la mi byed pa ste /
translated: not to think of anything else that would be a hindrance to enlightenment.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s pure morality.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa @353b shes shing drin du gzo ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa @353b shes shing drin du gzo ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s gratitude and its practice?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When the bodhisattva-mahāsattva practices the bodhisattva conduct,

original: phan pa chung ngu zhig byas kyang 'khor ba zad kyi bar du chud mi gzon na mang po lta ci smos te /
analyzed: phan pa chung ngu zhig byas kyang 'khor ba zad kyi bar du chud mi gzon na mang po lta ci smos te /
translated: even if someone does him a small favor, he does not forget it until the end of saṃsāra, let alone a great one.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byas pa shes shing drin du gzo ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s gratitude and its practice.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s patience and its practice?

original: sems can thams cad la gnod sems med cing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la gnod sems med cing /
translated: They have no malice toward any being.

original: 'tshe ba med pa'i sems te /
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa'i sems te /
translated: It is the absence of malice and the absence of violence toward all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i mthu la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s patience that is a power.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s experience of joy and delight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: sems can thams cad theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byed pa ste /
translated: bringing all sentient beings to maturity in the three vehicles.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rab tu dga' zhing spro ba myong bar bya'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s experience of joy and delight.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s not abandoning any sentient being?🔽It is this:

original: 'di ltar sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa ste /
translated: protecting all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtang ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s not abandoning any sentient being.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s realization of great compassion?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practice bodhisattva conduct,

original: 'di snyam du sems shing /🔽@354a *// bdag gis sems can re re'i don du'ang bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems shing / @354a *// bdag gis sems can re re'i don du'ang bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du /
translated: they think like this:

original: sems can dmyal bar gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar gnas par bya ste /
translated: ‘For the sake of each and every sentient being, I will remain in the hells for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la ma bkod kyi bar du de dag tu gtub cing gshags pa dang / brdung zhing btso ba dang / bsreg pa la sogs pa nyams su myong bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la ma bkod kyi bar du de dag tu gtub cing gshags pa dang / brdung zhing btso ba dang / bsreg pa la sogs pa nyams su myong bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: Until all sentient beings are established in the wisdom of the buddhas, I will experience being cut, gashed, beaten, boiled, burned, and so forth in those hells.’

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi don du spro zhing skyo ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi don du spro zhing skyo ba med pa ste /
translated: Thus, for the sake of all sentient beings, they are enthusiastic and do not become weary.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i snying rje chen po mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s realization of great compassion.”

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla ma la bsnyen bkur zhing dad pas gus par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla ma la bsnyen bkur zhing dad pas gus par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s honoring and revering the guru with faith and respect?

original: 'di ltar bla ma rnams la ston pa'i 'du shes su byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bla ma rnams la ston pa'i 'du shes su byed pa ste /
translated: It is the attitude of regarding the guru as the Teacher.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla ma la bsnyen bkur zhing dad pas gus par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bla ma la bsnyen bkur zhing dad pas gus par bya ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s honoring and revering the guru with faith and respect.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson zhing 'tshol ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson zhing 'tshol ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s striving and seeking the perfections?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: las gzhan med par sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: las gzhan med par sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: without any other work, for the sake of bringing all beings to maturity,

original: las gzhan med par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su 'tshol ba ste /
analyzed: las gzhan med par pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su 'tshol ba ste /
translated: without any other work, seeking the perfections.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson zhing 'tshol ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la brtson zhing 'tshol ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s striving and seeking the perfections.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mang du thos pas mi ngoms pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mang du thos pas mi ngoms pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ insatiable thirst for learning consist in?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽@354b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / @354b sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'am /
translated: It is this:

original: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gang ci bstan pa de dag thams cad yongs su gzung bar bya'o //🔽zhes mi ngoms pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gang ci bstan pa de dag thams cad yongs su gzung bar bya'o // zhes mi ngoms pa ste /
translated: ‘Whatever is taught by the blessed buddhas in this world system or in all the world systems of the ten directions, I will retain it all.’

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mang du thos pas mi ngoms pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mang du thos pas mi ngoms pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattvas’ insatiable thirst for learning.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattvas’ discernment of the gift of Dharma without material interest consist in?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos ston pa'i tshe /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po chos ston pa'i tshe /
translated: When bodhisattva great beings teach the Dharma,

original: chos kyi sbyin pa des chung ngu na byang chub tu'ang re ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa des chung ngu na byang chub tu'ang re ba med pa ste /
translated: they do not even hope for awakening through that gift of Dharma.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i zang zing med par chos kyi sbyin pa rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s discernment of the gift of the Dharma without material possessions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s planting of roots of goodness and dedication to purifying a buddhafield?

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dang gang gis /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dang gang gis /
translated: Whatever roots of goodness

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byed cing /
translated: are used to purify a buddhafield,

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi sems kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi sems kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i tshe /
translated: when purifying the field of one’s own and others’ minds,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag yongs su bsngo ba ste /
translated: those roots of goodness are dedicated.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s planting of roots of goodness and dedication to purifying a buddhafield.
