analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfection of family?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rigs chen por skye ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rigs chen por skye ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva is born into a great family,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rigs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfection of family.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rgyud phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba'am /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rgyud phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rgyal rigs che zhing mtho ba'am /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfection of lineage?🔽The bodhisattva-mahāsattva is born into a great kṣatriya family

original: bram ze'i rigs che zhing mtho bar skye ba ste /
analyzed: bram ze'i rigs che zhing mtho bar skye ba ste /
translated: or a great brahmin family,

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rgyud phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rgyud phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfection of lineage.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rus phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rus phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfection of clan?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi rigs sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams byung bar gyur pa de'i rigs su skye ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi rigs sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams byung bar gyur pa de'i rigs su skye ba ste /
translated: The family of a bodhisattva-mahāsattva is the family in which previous bodhisattvas have appeared.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rus phun sum tshogs pa'o //🔽de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i @365a *//
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i rus phun sum tshogs pa'o // de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i @365a *//
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfection of family.

original: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfection of retinue consist in?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub la sems can rnams bkod cing /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub la sems can rnams bkod cing /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva establishes beings in awakening,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: and they become his retinue of bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfection of retinue.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshe phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshe phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, does the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfection of life consist in?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyes ma thag tu 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas rgyas par bkang ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po skyes ma thag tu 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas rgyas par bkang ste /
translated: He is a bodhisattva mahāsattva who, as soon as he is born, fills the world systems in the ten directions with light,

original: de dag rnam pa drug tu g-yo bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag rnam pa drug tu g-yo bar byed pa ste /
translated: and causes them to shake in six ways.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshe phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshe phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s perfection of life.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na; byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s perfection of going forth?

original: sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig tu mngon par 'byung zhing /
analyzed: sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma dang lhan cig tu mngon par 'byung zhing /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva goes forth together with many hundred thousands of quintillions of beings,

original: sems can de dag kyang theg pa gsum la nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang theg pa gsum la nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: and those beings also go forth in the Three Vehicles.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i mngon par 'byung ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva mahāsattva’s perfection of going forth.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfect adornment of the tree of awakening?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi shing gi rtsa ba gser gyi rgyu las byung ba yin /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi shing gi rtsa ba gser gyi rgyu las byung ba yin /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s tree of awakening has a root made of gold.

original: lhun be @365b d'uryar 'dug pa yin /
analyzed: lhun be @365b d'uryar 'dug pa yin /
translated: Its trunk is made of beryl.

original: yal ga rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin las grub pa yin /
analyzed: yal ga rin po che sna bdun gyi rang bzhin las grub pa yin /
translated: Its branches are made of the seven precious substances.

original: me tog dang / lo ma rin po che thams cad las gyur pa yin /
analyzed: me tog dang / lo ma rin po che thams cad las gyur pa yin /
translated: Its flowers and leaves are made of all precious substances.

original: shing de'i dri zhim po dang / 'od bzang pos 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rgyas par 'geng ba yin te /
analyzed: shing de'i dri zhim po dang / 'od bzang pos 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa rgyas par 'geng ba yin te /
translated: The sweet fragrance and beautiful light of that tree fills infinite world systems.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i byang chub kyi shing gi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: That is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfect adornment of the tree of awakening.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfect completion of all good qualities?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: the purification of the maturation of sentient beings, and the purification of the Buddha-field.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yon tan thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s perfection of all good qualities.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bcu la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bcu la gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by the bodhisattva-mahāsattva abiding on the tenth stage being called a Tathāgata?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: It is the bodhisattva-mahāsattva who has perfected all the perfections, and who has the ten powers of a Tathāgata, the four forms of fearlessness, the four forms of exact knowledge, the four forms of unobstructed understanding, the eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha, and great loving kindness and great compassion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang yongs su @366a *//
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang yongs su @366a *//
translated: the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, the gnosis of omniscience, the abandonment of all afflictions along with their traces, great compassion, and all the qualities of the Buddha.🔽

original: rdzogs par gyur pa dag ste /
analyzed: rdzogs par gyur pa dag ste /
translated: the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, the gnosis of omniscience, the abandonment of all afflictive emotions together with their habitual tendencies, great compassion, and all the qualities of the Buddha are perfected.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bcu la gnas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sa bcu la gnas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, in this way the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is on the tenth level is called a tathāgata.

original: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa bcu gang zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, what are the ten levels of the bodhisattva mahāsattva?

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po thabs mkhas pas /
translated: Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who is on the first level should perfect the pāramitā of generosity.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la spyod pa dang / stong pa nyid thams cad dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams dang / bsam gtan rnams dang / tshad med pa rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang /
translated: all the kinds of emptiness, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the four noble truths, the concentrations, the immeasurables, the formless absorptions,

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu dang / stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par shes pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnams dang /
translated: the eight deliverances, the nine serial absorptions, emptiness, signlessness, and aspirationlessness, the clairvoyances, the meditative stabilizations, the dhāraṇī gateways,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa las yang dag par 'da'/
analyzed: dkar po rnam par mthong ba'i sa las yang dag par 'da'/
translated: they transcend the stage of bright vision,

original: rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs @366b rgyas kyi sa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi sa dang / brgyad pa'i sa dang / mthong ba'i sa dang / bsrabs pa'i sa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sa dang / byas pa rtogs pa'i sa dang / nyan thos kyi sa dang / rang sangs @366b rgyas kyi sa dang /
translated: the stage of lineage, the eighth stage, the stage of insight, the stage of thinning, the stage of separation from desire, the stage of realizing what is to be done, the śrāvaka stage, the pratyekabuddha stage,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las yang dag par 'das te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa las yang dag par 'das te /
translated: and the bodhisattva stage.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa dgu las yongs su 'das pa nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sa dgu las yongs su 'das pa nas /
translated: Subhūti, in this way bodhisattva great beings transcend the nine stages,

original: sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sa la gnas pa ste /
translated: and then they stand in the buddha stage.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa bcu pa'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sa bcu pa'o //
translated: Subhūti, that is the bodhisattva great beings’ tenth stage.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par rig par bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, in this way you should know that bodhisattva great beings have set out in the Great Vehicle.”🔽“

original: rab 'byor / khyod kyis gang mang 'di skad du theg pa de gang nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod kyis gang mang 'di skad du theg pa de gang nas 'byung bar 'gyur zhes smras pa de ni /
translated: “Subhūti, you have asked, ‘Where will that vehicle come from?’

original: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis khams gsum nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis khams gsum nas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It will come from the three realms, but not by apprehending anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will stand in the knowledge of all aspects,🔽but not by apprehending anything.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ka'ang ldan ba'ang ma yin /🔽mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar theg pa chen po gang yin pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang yin pa'i chos de gnyis ka'ang ldan ba'ang ma yin / mi ldan pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, those two dharmas—that is, the Great Vehicle and the knowledge of all aspects—are not conjoined and not disjoined;

original: gzugs med pa /
analyzed: gzugs med pa /
translated: they are formless,

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: cannot be pointed out,

original: thogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa ste /
translated: do not obstruct,

original: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'o //
translated: and have only one mark—that is, no mark.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / mtshan nyid med pa'i chos ni 'byung ba'am /🔽'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / mtshan nyid med pa'i chos ni 'byung ba'am / 'byung bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Subhūti, a dharma without marks does not come or go or stand;🔽it does not arise or cease;

original: 'byung bar gyur pa med de /
analyzed: 'byung bar gyur pa med de /
translated: it is not diminished or increased;🔽it is not defiled or purified;🔽it is not born or dies;🔽it is not broken or cut;🔽it is not burned or chafed;🔽it is not bound or freed.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni chos kyi dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni chos kyi dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: Subhūti, whoever wants to make non-entity dharmas arise would be making the dharma-constituent arise.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar @367a *//🔽'dod pa de ni /🔽de bzhin nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar @367a *// 'dod pa de ni / de bzhin nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: Subhūti, whoever wants to make non-entity dharmas arise would be making thusness arise.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /🔽yang dag pa'i mtha' 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni / yang dag pa'i mtha' 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: Subhūti, whoever wants to make non-entity dharmas arise would be making the very limit of reality arise.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /🔽bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: Subhūti, whoever wants to make non-entity dharmas arise would be making the inconceivable element arise.🔽Subhūti, whoever wants to make non-entity dharmas arise would be making the space element arise.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /🔽nam mkha'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni / nam mkha'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: Subhūti, whoever wants to make non-entity dharmas arise would be making the unadulterated element arise.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, whoever wants to make non-entity dharmas arise would be making the unattached element arise.

original: 'dod chags zad pa'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags zad pa'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: It is just that they want the realm of the extinction of desire to come about.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, those who want to make dharmas without marks come about want

original: rab tu byang ba'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: rab tu byang ba'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: the realm of complete nirvana to come about.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, those who want to make dharmas without marks come about want

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: the realm of separation from desire to come about.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, those who want to make dharmas without marks come about want

original: 'gog pa'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i dbyings 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: the realm of cessation to come about.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, those who want to make dharmas without marks come about want

original: gzugs stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: the emptiness of form to come about.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, those who want to make dharmas without marks come about want

original: tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / 'du shes stong pa @367b nyid dang / 'du byed stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / 'du shes stong pa @367b nyid dang / 'du byed stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: it is just that the emptiness of feeling, the emptiness of perception, the emptiness of volitional factors, and the emptiness of consciousness are spoken of.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: rab 'byor / gzugs stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: Su­bhūti, it is because the emptiness of physical forms does not emerge from the three world systems,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: and it does not stand in omniscience.

original: tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / 'du shes stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: tshor ba stong pa nyid dang / 'du shes stong pa nyid dang / 'du byed stong pa nyid dang / rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: The emptiness of feeling, the emptiness of perception, the emptiness of volitional factors, and the emptiness of consciousness do not emerge from the three world systems,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: and they do not stand in omniscience.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you ask why,

original: 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is because physical forms are empty of physical forms,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnam par shes pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are empty of consciousness.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, someone who wants to make non-entity dharmas arise

original: mig stong pa nyid 'byung par 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: mig stong pa nyid 'byung par 'dod du zad do //
translated: is someone who wants to make emptiness of the eyes arise.

original: rab 'byor gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, someone who wants to make non-entity dharmas arise

original: rna ba stong pa nyid dang / sna stong pa nyid dang / lce stong pa nyid dang / lus stong pa nyid dang / yid stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rna ba stong pa nyid dang / sna stong pa nyid dang / lce stong pa nyid dang / lus stong pa nyid dang / yid stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: is someone who wants to make emptiness of the ears, emptiness of the nose, emptiness of the tongue, emptiness of the body, and emptiness of the thinking mind arise. And why?

original: rab 'byor / mig stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / mig stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: Subhūti, emptiness of the eyes does not come from the three realms.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: It does not stay in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rna ba stong pa nyid dang / sna stong pa nyid dang / lce stong pa nyid dang / lus stong pa nyid dang / yid stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: rna ba stong pa nyid dang / sna stong pa nyid dang / lce stong pa nyid dang / lus stong pa nyid dang / yid stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: Emptiness of the ears, emptiness of the nose, emptiness of the tongue, emptiness of the body, and emptiness of the thinking mind do not come from the three realms.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: They do not stay in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de @368a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de @368a *//
translated: Subhūti,

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is it so?

original: 'di ltar mig mig gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig mig gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye is empty of the eye.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid yid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body, and thinking mind are empty of the thinking mind.

original: rab 'byor; gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor; gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, anyone who wants to go forth from phenomena that have no mark

original: gzugs stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: gzugs stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: wants to go forth from the emptiness of form.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, anyone who wants to go forth from phenomena that have no mark

original: sgra stong pa nyid dang / dri stong pa nyid dang / ro stong pa nyid dang / reg stong pa nyid dang / chos stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: sgra stong pa nyid dang / dri stong pa nyid dang / ro stong pa nyid dang / reg stong pa nyid dang / chos stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: wants to go forth from the emptiness of sound, smell, taste, feeling, and dharmas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rab 'byor / gzugs stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzugs stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: Subhūti, the emptiness of form does not come from the three realms.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: It does not stay in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: and the emptiness of dharmas does not come from the three realms.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: It does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, why is that?

original: 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs gzugs kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, Subhūti, form is empty of form.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos chos kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg dang / chos chos kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sound, smell, taste, feeling, and dharmas are empty of dharmas.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, someone who wants to cause dharmas without marks to arise

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: would want to cause the emptiness of the eye consciousness to arise.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, someone who wants to cause dharmas without marks to arise🔽would want to cause the emptiness of the eye sense-sphere to arise.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa @368b stong pa nyid dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa @368b stong pa nyid dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: and the emptiness of the mind consciousness.

original: rab 'byor / mig gi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / mig gi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: If you ask why, Su­bhūti, it is because the emptiness of the eye consciousness does not come or go,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: and it does not stand or fall.

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do; ;rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do; ;rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: and the emptiness of the consciousness of the mental faculty do not come from the three realms, and they do not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, why is that?

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa mig gi rnam par shes pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the consciousness of the eye is empty of the consciousness of the eye,

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the consciousness of the ear, the consciousness of the nose, the consciousness of the tongue, the consciousness of the body, and the consciousness of the mental faculty are empty of the consciousness of the mental faculty.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, someone who wants to emerge into dharmas that have no marks

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: Subhūti, it is just that you want to say that the emptiness of the sensory element of the ears arises,🔽the emptiness of the sensory element of the nose arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of the tongue arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of the body arises, and the emptiness of the sensory element of the mental faculty arises.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Subhūti, it is just that you want to say that the emptiness of the sensory element of sights arises,🔽the emptiness of the sensory element of sounds arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of odors arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of tastes arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of tangibles arises, and the emptiness of the sensory element of mental phenomena arises.🔽Subhūti, it is just that you want to say that the emptiness of the sensory element of the eyes arises,

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / yid kyi @369a *//
analyzed: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / yid kyi @369a *//
translated: the emptiness of the sensory element of the ears arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of the nose arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of the tongue arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of the body arises, and the emptiness of the sensory element of the mental faculty arises.

original: 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid 'byung bar 'dod du zad do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, it is just that you want to say that the emptiness of the sensory element of sights arises,🔽the emptiness of the sensory element of sounds arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of odors arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of tastes arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of tangibles arises, and the emptiness of the sensory element of mental phenomena arises.🔽Subhūti, it is just that you want to say that the emptiness of the sensory element of visual consciousness arises,🔽the emptiness of the sensory element of auditory consciousness arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of olfactory consciousness arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of gustatory consciousness arises, the emptiness of the sensory element of tactile consciousness arises, and the emptiness of the sensory element of mental consciousness arises.

original: rab 'byor / mig gi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / mig gi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: Subhūti, it is just that you want to say that the emptiness of the sensory element of the eyes does not come from the three realms,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: and that it does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //

translated: the knowledge of all aspects does not stand or not stand in the three realms.🔽The emptiness of internal phenomena does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.

original: phyi stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //🔽rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: phyi stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: The emptiness of external phenomena does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of both external and internal phenomena does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.

analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do // rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do // dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: The emptiness of emptiness does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of great extent does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of ultimate reality does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of conditioned phenomena does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of unconditioned phenomena does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of the unlimited does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of non-dispersal does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of inherent existence does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of all things does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //🔽rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do // rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of non-apprehension does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of the absence of an intrinsic nature does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.

original: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid nang stong pa nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //🔽phyi stong pa nyid phyi stong pa nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nang stong pa nyid nang stong pa nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro // phyi stong pa nyid phyi stong pa nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of an intrinsic nature that is not lost does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of other things does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.🔽The emptiness of its own characteristics does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere, and does not even stand anywhere.

original: phyi nang stong pa nyid phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi nang stong pa nyid phyi nang stong pa nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The emptiness of all phenomena does not come from anywhere, does not go anywhere

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du /

analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /

translated: The result of once-returner, the result of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects do not come forth from the three realms,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: and they do not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe @374a *//🔽na; 'di ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe @374a *// na; 'di ltar rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: Why is it so, Subhūti?🔽It is because the intrinsic nature of the result of stream enterer

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is empty of the intrinsic nature of the result of stream enterer.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub dang / lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, the state of a worthy one, a pratyekabuddha’s awakening, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the intrinsic nature of the knowledge of all aspects is empty of the intrinsic nature of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /

original: ming 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: ming 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: has simply wanted to make a name arise.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /

analyzed: mtshan ma 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //

analyzed: mtshan ma stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //

original: gdags pa stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: gdags pa stong pa nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: “Subhūti, one who wants to emerge from the three realms🔽and who wants to stand in omniscience should not train in the perfection of wisdom.🔽“Sub

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //🔽rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do // rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: they do not stand in the knowledge of all modes.🔽And why?🔽Subhuti: Because the emptiness of the name is empty of the emptiness of the name,🔽the emptiness of the causal sign is empty of the emptiness of the causal sign,

original: 'di ltar ming stong pa nyid ni ming stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ming stong pa nyid ni ming stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the emptiness of the designation is empty of the emptiness of the designation,🔽the emptiness of the conventional name is empty of the emptiness of the conventional name,

original: mtshan ma stong pa nyid ni mtshan ma stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //🔽brda stong pa nyid ni brda stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //🔽tha snyad stong pa nyid ni tha snyad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma stong pa nyid ni mtshan ma stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro // brda stong pa nyid ni brda stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro // tha snyad stong pa nyid ni tha snyad stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the emptiness of the essential original nature is empty of the emptiness of the essential original nature,🔽the emptiness of all dharmas is empty of the emptiness of all dharmas,🔽the emptiness of own-marks is empty of the emptiness of own-marks,🔽the emptiness of the conditioned element is empty of the emptiness of the conditioned element,🔽the emptiness of the unconditioned element is empty of the emptiness of the unconditioned element,

original: gdags pa stong pa nyid ni gdags pa stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //🔽rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: gdags pa stong pa nyid ni gdags pa stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro // rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni /
translated: the emptiness of the ultimate is empty of the emptiness of the ultimate,

original: skye ba med pa 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: skye ba med pa 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: the emptiness of the unformed is empty of the emptiness of the unformed.🔽Subhuti: If, O Lord, the emptiness of the name is empty of the emptiness of the name, etc. to: the emptiness of the unformed is empty of the emptiness of the unformed, then how can one apprehend the differentiation of the emptinesses?🔽The Lord: If, Subhuti, the emptiness of the name had not been empty of the emptiness of the name, etc. to: if the emptiness of the unformed had not been empty of the emptiness of the unformed, then a Bodhisattva, a great being could not fully know the emptinesses.🔽But since, Subhuti, the emptiness of the name is empty of the emptiness of the name, etc. to: the emptiness of the unformed is empty of the emptiness of the unformed, therefore a Bodhisattva, a great being, can fully know the emptinesses.

original: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang mtshan nyid med pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'dod pa de ni 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa 'byung bar 'dod du zad do //
translated: Subhūti, whoever wants to make non-existent phenomena arise is just wanting to make non-stopping, non-affliction, non-purification, and non-conditioning arise.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: Subhūti, the intrinsic nature of non-production does not come out of the three realms.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //🔽'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang @375a *//
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do // 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang @375a *//
translated: It does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med do //
translated: The intrinsic nature of non-stopping, non-affliction, non-purification, and non-conditioning does not come out of the three realms.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med do //
translated: It does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Subhūti, why is that?

original: 'di ltar skye ba med pa ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //🔽'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye ba med pa ni skye ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro // 'gag pa med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par byang ba med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa ni /
translated: Thus, non-production is empty of the intrinsic nature of non-production.

original: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-cessation, non-affliction, non-purification, and non-performance are empty of the intrinsic nature of non-performance.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar rnam grangs des na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar rnam grangs des na /
translated: Subhūti, through this one of many explanations

original: 'di ltar theg pa chen po ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med /
analyzed: 'di ltar theg pa chen po ni khams gsum nas 'byung ba med /
translated: you should know that the Great Vehicle does not come forth from the three realms,

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du gnas pa med par shes par bya ste /
translated: and does not stand in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: gnas pa med pa de ni bskyod du med pa'o ////
analyzed: gnas pa med pa de ni bskyod du med pa'o ////
translated: That which does not stand cannot be moved.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag nyi shu lnga pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Twenty-Five Thousand Lines

original: bam po bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu dgu pa /
translated: The Nineteenth Session

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang khyod kyis gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang khyod kyis gang 'di skad du /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, you asked,

original: theg pa chen po de gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes smras pa de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po de gang du gnas par 'gyur zhes smras pa de /
translated: ‘Where will that Great Vehicle stand?’

original: theg pa chen po de gang du'ang gnas par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po de gang du'ang gnas par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: That Great Vehicle does not stand anywhere.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni gnas mi dmigs pa'i phyir mi gnas pa ste /🔽rab 'byor / de ltar theg pa chen po de ni mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos thams cad ni gnas mi dmigs pa'i phyir mi gnas pa ste / rab 'byor / de ltar theg pa chen po de ni mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
translated: Because all dharmas do not stand.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / chos kyi dbyings ni gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / chos kyi dbyings ni gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, that Great Vehicle stands in such a way that it does not stand.

original: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin du theg @375b pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no // rab 'byor / de bzhin du theg @375b pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as the dharma-dhātu does not stand and does not not stand.

original: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //🔽rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no // rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, just so that Great Vehicle does not stand and does not not stand.

original: dper na / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings ni gnas pa'ang ma yin /🔽mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin du theg pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings ni gnas pa'ang ma yin / mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no // rab 'byor / de bzhin du theg pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, it is just as suchness, the very limit of reality, and the inconceivable element do not stand and do not not stand.

original: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Subhūti, just so that Great Vehicle does not stand and does not not stand.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa'am /
translated: Subhuti: The Bodhisattva, the great being, who has stood in the perfection of wisdom as it has been explained, and who courses in the perfection of wisdom, he should thus train in the emptiness of the subject, etc. to: in the emptiness of the nonexistence of own-being.

original: mi gnas pa med do //🔽de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid la ni gnas pa'am /
analyzed: mi gnas pa med do // de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid la ni gnas pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, there is no abiding or non-abiding in the essence of the dharma-constituent.

original: mi gnas pa med do //
analyzed: mi gnas pa med do //
translated: There is no abiding or non-abiding in the essence of suchness, the very limit of reality, or the inconceivable expanse.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bzhin nyid de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar chos kyi dbyings chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin nyid de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the dharma-constituent is empty of the essence of the dharma-constituent.🔽Suchness is empty of the essence of suchness.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' yang dag pa'i mtha'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The very limit of reality is empty of the essence of the very limit of reality.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inconceivable expanse is empty of the essence of the inconceivable expanse.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste; dper na /🔽nam mkha'i dbyings ni gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste; dper na / nam mkha'i dbyings ni gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: the expanse of space neither abides nor does not abide.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du theg pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin /🔽mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du theg pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin / mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the Great Vehicle does not stand or not stand.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / 'dod chags zad pa'i dbyings ni gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / 'dod chags zad pa'i dbyings ni gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //🔽de bzhin du theg pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma @376a *//
analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no // de bzhin du theg pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma @376a *//
translated: the realm of the exhaustion of desire does not stand or not stand.

original: yin; mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: yin; mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the Great Vehicle does not stand or not stand.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / rab tu byang ba'i dbyings dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings dang / 'gog pa'i dbyings la ni gnas pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / rab tu byang ba'i dbyings dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings dang / 'gog pa'i dbyings la ni gnas pa'am /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: mi gnas pa med do //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin du theg pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: mi gnas pa med do // rab 'byor / de bzhin du theg pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: the realm of complete purification, the realm of freedom from desire, and the realm of cessation do not stand or not stand.

original: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, the Great Vehicle does not stand or not stand.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽nam mkha'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid la ni gnas pa'am /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / nam mkha'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid la ni gnas pa'am /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi gnas pa med do //
analyzed: mi gnas pa med do //
translated: In the essence of the realm of space, there is no standing or not standing.

original: 'dod chags zad pa'i dbyings dang / rab tu byang ba'i dbyings dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings dang / 'gog pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid la ni gnas pa'am mi gnas pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags zad pa'i dbyings dang / rab tu byang ba'i dbyings dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dbyings dang / 'gog pa'i dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid la ni gnas pa'am mi gnas pa med do //
translated: The realm of the extinction of desire, the realm of complete purification, the realm of freedom from desire, and the realm of cessation have no essence that abides or does not abide.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar nam mkha'i dbyings nam mkha'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni 'di ltar nam mkha'i dbyings nam mkha'i dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhūti, it is because the realm of space is empty of the intrinsic nature of the realm of space.

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du theg pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du theg pa chen po de'ang gnas pa'ang ma yin /

original: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //

translated: The intrinsic nature of an illusion, the intrinsic nature of a mirage, the intrinsic nature of an echo, the intrinsic nature of a magical creation, the intrinsic nature of a reflection, and the intrinsic nature of a tathāgata’s emanation do not stand or not stand.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid rang sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid la ni gnas pa'am mi gnas pa med do //

translated: Su­bhūti, it is just as, for example, the fruit of entering the stream is neither existent nor nonexistent.

analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no // rang byang chub ni gnas pa'ang ma yin /
translated: The fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, and arhatship are neither existent nor nonexistent.

analyzed: mi gnas pa'ang ma yin no //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: rang byang chub kyi ngo bo nyid la ni gnas pa'am mi gnas pa med do //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
